triples.name: Constraint programming
triples.relevance: The paper addresses the problem of learning efficient heuristics within constraint programming solvers.

triples.name: Machine learning
triples.relevance: The paper proposes a machine learning approach to automatically learn value-selection heuristics without expert intervention.

triples.name: Q-learning
triples.relevance: Deep Q-learning is a core component of the proposed framework for learning value-selection heuristics.

triples.name: Graph neural network
triples.relevance: A heterogeneous graph neural network is used to process the search state representation in the proposed framework.

triples.name: Graph coloring
triples.relevance: Graph coloring is used as one of the benchmark problems to evaluate the proposed value-selection heuristic.

triples.name: Maximum independent set
triples.relevance: Maximum independent set is used as one of the benchmark problems to evaluate the proposed value-selection heuristic.

triples.name: Maximum cut
triples.relevance: Maximum cut is used as one of the benchmark problems to evaluate the proposed value-selection heuristic.

triples.name: Value-selection heuristic
triples.relevance: The paper proposes a new generic learning procedure to automatically obtain value-selection heuristics inside constraint programming solvers.
